verb.description: Combine or cause to combine to form a single entity.
examples: the utility companies are cutting costs and merging with other companies
the company plans to merge its U.S. oil production operations with those of a London-based organization
the files were merged using the patient identification code as the common variable

origin: Mid 17th century (in the sense immerse oneself): from Latin mergere to dip, plunge; the legal sense is from Anglo-Norman French merger.
